Find Overlapping Clusters

Source: R/gm_diagnostics.R
find_overlapping_clusters.Rd

Identifies clusters with significant overlap based on separation threshold.

Usage

find_overlapping_clusters(analysis_data)

Arguments

analysis_data

Standardized GM analysis data

Value

List of overlapping cluster pairs, or NULL if no overlaps detected. Each list element contains:

  • cluster1: Character. Name of first cluster

  • cluster2: Character. Name of second cluster

  • distance: Numeric. Mahalanobis distance between clusters

Details

Clusters are considered overlapping if their Mahalanobis distance is below the threshold of 2.0. This indicates poor cluster separation and potential issues with the clustering solution.

Mahalanobis distance accounts for both the distance between cluster centers and the covariance structure of the clusters, providing a more informative measure than Euclidean distance.

See also

find_distinguishing_variables_gm() for identifying key variables per cluster

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# After running GM interpretation
library(mclust)
gmm_model <- Mclust(scale(data), G = 3)
var_info <- data.frame(variable = names(data), description = names(data))
interpretation <- interpret(gmm_model, variable_info = var_info,
                           llm_provider = "ollama", llm_model = "gpt-oss:20b-cloud")

# Check for overlapping clusters
analysis_data <- interpretation$analysis_data
overlaps <- find_overlapping_clusters(analysis_data)
if (!is.null(overlaps)) {
  print("Found overlapping cluster pairs:")
  print(overlaps)
}
} # }
